body:
> /kind feature

**What happened**:
While following through this tls [bootstrapping guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/kubelet-tls-bootstrapping/#token-authentication-file) I accidentally made a file with blank tokens. (format was `,kubelet,kubelet`). I noticed that there was a particular format recommended in this guide but I don’t see that we do any verification of the token when [loading the file](https://github.com/kubernetes/apiserver/blob/master/pkg/authentication/token/tokenfile/tokenfile.go#L43). I also noted that you can enter any string as a token and authenticate.

**What you expected to happen**:
I'd expect the apiserver to verify the token length, or at least warn if no token is provided. I did verify that when the token is set to blank a user is not able to auth by providing an empty string as the token in `~.kube/config`.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Run the `kube-apiserver` with `--token-auth-file` pointing to a file with the value `,kubectl,kubectl`

**Anything else we need to know?**:
Nope.

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
